title: How can this behavior not result in a permaban?
body:
I have played a long time.  3 years or more, however I have never encountered such a toxic player.

(name removed)

I just played a game with this guy, and what really hit me the most was him saying

"I hope your mother gets raped"

Who says that? Who in their right mind, trolling even, would say such hateful words.  Mute him, down vote me, don't play if you cant handle this negative attitude.  It does not matter, this crossed a line that never should have been crossed in any game.

replies.body:
Hey summoner,

I 100% agree with you. This kind of behaviour has no place in League, and it's quite disheartening to see some players choose to act this way. 

_As for his punishment:_

+ The [Instant Feedback system](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-) would have issued any disciplinary measures in this case. While I can't honestly say he was perma-banned for sure (especially if this was his first offence), it is very likely that he's skipped directly to more severe punishments such as a 14 day ban.

 If he continues this he'll be banned very quickly (usually at most 2 - 3 games of severe offences).

There's always progress to be made here IMO. The instant feedback system is working better than most people give it credit for, but as you can see it's not perfect and there's still plenty of toxicity in League.

I'm really glad you brought this up though. Having a healthy discussion and highlighting the issues, is the first step to a finding solution to the problem :)

>Is condoned
